intro: Oreosyce africana, commonly known as African oreosyce, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. The leaves are usually broad and heart-shaped, contributing to its ornamental value.
